title: What is the significance of creating a tangible body of glory in Taoism and how does it relate to achieving immortality?
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the concept of immortality through the Taoism philosophy, exploring the idea of creating a tangible body of glory and achieving mastery over the physical body. The author mentions various teachers who have written about the different levels of immortality, which involve the understanding of the material world and the self-reflection process. The author goes on to suggest that the study of works by Gustav Meyrink and Isha Schwaller de Lubicz can provide valuable insights into this topic. Meyrink, born in Vienna in 1868, was a former banker who turned to writing and is known for his work "The Green Face," while Schwaller de Lubicz was a French philosopher and writer whose book "Her-Bak: Egyptian Initiate" explores ancient Egyptian culture and spirituality.
